intro: Dysophylla strigosa, commonly known as the hairy dysophylla, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, hairy texture, giving it its common name. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom during the warmer months. Dysophylla strigosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
